Dear Sheffield City Council,
I would like to be given the mini holland bid document and supporting appendices for the Connecting Darnall proposal, which has been submitted to Active Travel England.
Yours faithfully,
Roy Martin

Dear Sheffield City Council FOI Officer,
Has this request been received?
Yours faithfully,
Roy Martin

Dear Roy Martin,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Darnall Mini
Holland which we received on 22/05/2023.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 20/06/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear FOI,
This request is overdue. It would be acceptable for you to send the main report ahead of the Appendices.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear FOI,
An acknowledgement would be the polite and civil thing to do.
Either set out a timetable of when you plan to supply documents which do not need creating or accept this as a request for an internal review.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear FOI,
The deadline of 20/06/2023 has passed without any form of communication from yourselves.
Please pass to this to the person who conducts your internal reviews
Reasons:
- Lack of communication and openness
- failing to meet the statutory deadline without explanation
The document requested only required minor redactions of information and has been readily available for circulation.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear Roy Martin,
Thank you for your recent request for an internal review relating to
Darnall Mini Holland which we received on 11/07/2023. We are sorry to hear
that you are not happy with your response.
This has now been logged and will be carried out by a member of the team.
The Freedom of Information Code of Practice states that we should aim to
your request for internal review within 20 working days, by 08/08/2023.
Please do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you
have any queries.
Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this.
If you have any queries in the meantime, please contact us at the email
address below.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: Roy Martin <[FOI #982883 email]>
Sent: Tuesday, July 11, 2023 9:32 AM
To: FOI <[Sheffield City Council request email]>
Subject: Internal review of Freedom of Information request - Darnall Mini
Holland
Dear FOI,
The deadline of 20/06/2023 has passed without any form of communication
from yourselves.
Please pass to this to the person who conducts your internal reviews
Reasons:
- Lack of communication and openness
- failing to meet the statutory deadline without explanation
The document requested only required minor redactions of information and
has been readily available for circulation.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear FOI,
The deadline of 8th of August approaches in just over a week.
A kind reminder, as the original request was 22nd of May, I can only presume there is a great deal of feet dragging in releasing this information.  Evidence suggest you will be requesting an extension of the deadline for an internal request. If you do wish to delay further, it would be appropriate to inform me in writing of the desire to once again extend the deadline.
"Please note that the Code of Practice does allow us to extend this
deadline by an additional 20 days in some situations. If we need more time
to complete the internal review, we will contact you to inform you of
this."
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Good morning,
Happy 8th of August.
Do you wish to extend the deadline?
I will take a lack of response as a no and will be referring the case to the information commissioner at the end of this week.
Yours sincerely,
Roy

Dear FOI,
As you have not requested an extension to the deadline and ignored my corresponds once again, I will consider this a non-response.
This case should now be referred to the information commissioner for external review.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Hello Mr Martin
Apologies for our delay, we'll be responding this afternoon.
Kind regards
Sheffield City Council

Dear Mr Martin
Thank you for your request for an internal review on 11 July 2023, and
apologies for missing our deadline of 8 August 2023. We acknowledge your
chasers of 8 and 11 August 2023. We accept your complaint about our
failure to respond to your original request of 22 May 2023 for the
Connecting Darnall proposal. We breached Regulation 5(2) of the
Environmental Information Regulations 2004 which requires a response
within 20 working days. It was due on 20 June 2023. We had the information
available to send you on 19 June 2023. But it was overlooked due to our
workload. We sincerely apologise for this lapse on our part and hope you
have not been too inconvenienced by the delay.
We confirmed with Active Travel England they were happy for us to share
our bid documents publicly. We are attaching the addendum, but the main
proposal (204 pages) and the community engagement strategy (42 pages)
retain the names of the three consultants, which we need to redact. We
will do that first thing on Monday morning and send them on to you.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]

Dear FOI,
The report promised for Monday 14th of August is still outstanding.
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin

Dear FOI,
"But it was overlooked due to our workload. We sincerely apologise for this lapse on our part and hope you
have not been too inconvenienced by the delay."
The report has not been provided, several weeks after the assigned date of 14th of August.
Unlike my other request, it is disproportionate to refer this to the information commission. Is there another person internal to SCC to whom I may submit a complaint about the endless delays to this simple request?
Yours sincerely,
Roy Martin
